definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: "Pseudo-mother, " sparked a heated war of words.
sentences.chinese: “伪娘”引发了一场激烈的口水战。

sentences.english: Do you think spending whole lot of time to wage a spit war with China is meaningful?
sentences.chinese: 你可有想过成天打中国的口水战有意义吗？

sentences.english: Eat a peach cut not peeled another north-south netizens slobber war.
sentences.chinese: 吃桃子削不削皮再掀南北网友口水战。

sentences.english: Moammar Gadhafi's government, for its part, kept up the war of words.
sentences.chinese: 而卡扎菲政府仍然坚持无尽的口水战。

sentences.english: How do you think of the flame wars between fans of stars?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么看待明星粉丝间的口水战？

definition: to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
(slang) (lit.) to tear cunt/(fig.) (of females) to have a catfight/to have a bitch fight
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
